Reviews.Title: Simple and easy, but beautiful
Reviews.Author: TAM
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this frame, to many (but not all) people.If you want a simple to use frame, with absolutely gorgeous image quality, this is the one for you.  Grandma could operate it - just a few buttons.It'll display from it's memory, or from a USB stick or card (and probably other things I haven't used).  With a couple buttons, you can copy the images from the USB etc. to the memory.It shows pictures in order by date modified, or random.  If you just load pics from the camera card, this will be perfect.If you edit images, you have to find some software to fix (reset) the date modified, if you want the photos in order.  There is a lot of freeware to do this.  Alternatively, you can download Kodak's free software to create slideshows - it sets the date to today, and then increments the time.  This works great for an individual slideshow - but not so good for adding things to the frame.But, if you just add new pictures as you shoot them, they'll stay in order.If you want a bunch of fancy options (music, video, etc) or want to be able to scroll around on the frame and select groups of pictures, those features are not on this frame.But personally, I'll deal with creating slideshows on the computer, and putting them on a stick.Did I mention, the color and photo quality is absolutely GEORGOUS?

Reviews.Title: Finally -- a toaster!
Reviews.Author: P. Dunegan
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a digital photo frame for ages, and the prices haven't come down all that much.  I liked the price and reviews on this one, so ordered two ... one for me and one for my daughter and her family.  It just came today (super-fast shipping), and I am so pleased.  Finally, an electronic gadget that's like a toaster ... you just plug it in and it works!!  No software to load, no gizmos to fiddle with, I just put in my usb flash drive with pics on it and plugged it in, and it worked right out of the box.  Yippee!

Reviews.Title: A great digital frame!
Reviews.Author: Kari Hall "movie maven"
Reviews.Content: Bought this frame for my parents for Christmas after a lengthy research process I decided on this one. Not just for it's very reasonable price but because it was supposed to be "a toaster" as in you plug it in and it works.. well that's exactly what it is. It's so easy to use! Thank goodness! I was scared it would be a hassle but we've found it just as easy as it has been touted.  You plug it in, put a flash drive in and the pictures are showing up beautifully. Vibrant pictures.  I have complete control I can just watch the slide show or I can freeze the frame or I can shuffle the pictures.. I can insert my camera memory right into the frame without having to use a flash drive if I want.  it's very simple.  If friends have pics to share with me they can just bring over a flash drive or their memory cards and it's wonderful!  I would recommend this for anyone young and old.  Whether they are computer savvy or not it is so easy anyone could do it.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: Simple to operate, but sequence restarts at photo 1
Reviews.Author: Naz Drovje
Reviews.Content: I got one for my mother, who was generally very satisfied with this frame. The only complaint I got is that the frame starts the slideshow from picture 1 upon power-on instead of the picture it was on at the previous shutdown. This is annoying if you have many photos, as the last one will never show up. I couldn't find a way to do this.

Reviews.Title: Put a smile on someone's face
Reviews.Author: Linda Bulger
Reviews.Content: My goal was to find a digital frame with great picture definition that would be reliable and easy to use. I did the usual: read lots of reviews, did lots of research. In the end I chose this Kodak EasyShare P725 Digital Frame although it was, I believe, a fairly new release.The frame was a birthday present for my friend, and I wanted her to be able to see pictures on it right away. This EasyShare plays pictures directly from the frame, or from a memory card or a USB flash drive. I chose pictures that I thought she'd like and spent a happy afternoon organizing them onto a SanDisk Cruzer, so she could enjoy the frame while selecting her own pictures. The picture quality is crisp and bright, and there is none of that "funhouse mirror" distortion that you sometimes get when the picture isn't the right shape for the frame. I knew my friend wouldn't be happy seeing herself and her family egg-shaped!If there is one thing about this product that could have been better, it's the user guide that came in the package. But the online extended user guide and support is excellent, so it was only a minor drawback. The directions suggested checking for software, firmware and driver downloads. Note that there are no downloads available at this time for Windows 7, so that could possibly be an issue for users who run that OS (as my friend and I both do). It wasn't an issue with this purchase since the drivers were up-to-date. There is EasyShare software available to be downloaded for free, to help with organizing, editing and uploading, but anyone who is satisfied with their current photo management software can pass it by.This gift was a big success and so far has performed very well. Isn't it satisfying when you have a great idea for a present and your research pays off, and the recipient totally enjoys it? This digital frame would put a smile on anyone's face.Linda Bulger, 2010

Reviews.Title: Kodak digital frame
Reviews.Author: Ankit Srivastava
Reviews.Content: This picture quality of this digital frame is very good. Only problem I faced with is while copying the pictures from my memory stick to its 512MB internal memory. U can only copy one picture at a time and that too is very slow. It takes a 10-20 seconds to copy each picture. So, internal memory is pretty useless.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures...that is about all
Reviews.Author: A. Griffin
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is beautiful.  That is my nice comment.  Otherwise, I really hated this frame...I am sincerely disappointed with it, as I felt Kodak would be a sure bet.  The frame is much smaller than I envisioned, but I suppose that is my fault for not measuring better.  There was no USB cable to hook directly to my computer to load the pics.  I ended up having to do it by putting pics on a sandisk and copying to the frame...which took all of 7 hours for 800 pics....cannot imagine trying it with the "4000" that it holds.  It balked when I tried to do all 800 at once, so I had to do them in batches of 100.  The frame starts at the first picture in the slideshow sequence every time you turn it off and on, so you never will see the last picture if you have very many on there.  The instructions are vague to say the least, and I waited on hold for over an hour on the online chat option and never did get any assistance.  I found the whole experience frustrating and downright riduculous.  It is a gift the night before Christmas so returning it is out, but when I go to buy my own or any other gifts, I can guarantee I will be looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: not bad, pay attention: no USB or memory card comes with it
Reviews.Author: A. Volkova
Reviews.Content: Not a bad frame or picture quality. However, please be aware that the frame will not be ready to work right out of the box UNLESS you already own either a USB cable or a memory card, as it does not come with either one of those. I was not paying attention to what's included, and similar frames I purchased before all came with own USB cable to connect them to the computer and download the photos. When I bought the memory card, it was difficult to insert it into the frame because of the design. It sticks out and is difficult to remove as well. However, if you own a USB cable, you will not have a problem.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't even last a year.  DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Destinie Bauer
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for Christmas '09, one for my mom and one for myself.  The one for myself has started randomly turning itself on, while my mom's has the opposite problem.  Hers just completely stopped working!  It is supposed to have a one year warranty, so I will try sending hers back.  I do not recommend this frame.  One thing I have never liked about it is that there is no way to set it to stay on one picture.  I would like to be able to just rotate pics on a daily basis, not constantly scroll through the entire contents.  I don't know if others have that option or not.  The appearance and picture quality were good, but that doesn't do me any good if the thing doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Good frame, not everything they promise
Reviews.Author: Carlos P
Reviews.Content: I was hoping the Kodak technology would enhance the pictures just as it appeared in the box, turns out it doesn't. So I fixed them in the PC and transferred them to an SD memory an it worked like a charm. I would have loved the frame had an option to copy photos from one removable memory to another instead of just to the internal memory. Also it only works with JPG, so make sure to convert your photos before transferring them.

Reviews.Title: No bells and whistles and a few quirks, but great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a gift and another for ourselves. We had another digital photo frame that was larger, but returned it because the screen flickered. The Kodak frame is easy to load. If you add photos from your USB device or SD card from your camera, it automatically resizes them, taking say, a 4 MB file down to 150 kb so the frame will hold more photos. The picture quality is excellent. The colors are vibrant and the images are crisp. You can display photos for 60, 10 or 5 seconds. My chief beef with the frame is that when using the 10 or 5 second settings, you get something like the Ken Burns effect. For those shorter time settings, the frame doesn't automatically center horizontal shots that are not cropped to a good shape for the frame. Portrait style or vertical photos are fine. But if you have a horizontal shot that is too large for the frame, it might show one small part of the photo, the upper left corner say. So the frame doesn't have options that let you turn off the Ken Burns effect when using the shorter times. That would be great.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but my parents were disappointed by the AC cord
Reviews.Author: Rabbit W
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these for my parents, and after the initial excitement, they realized that it required power from the AC cord. Why is this bad? Because they wanted to bring it to the senior center to show friends photos on it and thought it was too complicated to have to find an electrical outlet in the cafeteria.. Otherwise, let me say that the picture quality is great, considering the price especially. Setup was easy - my father figured it out in less than 15 minutes, I'd say. I think it's a pretty good product, but do admit that it would be cooler if it was battery-powered. But I suspect that having that feature would maybe result in poorer display quality (at least in this price range)?

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use and excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Margaret A. Mcglinch "Peg"
Reviews.Content: I love this picture frame because it's simple to use and the picture quality is excellent.  Set-up basically consists of inserting the picture card and plugging it in, so it was zipping through my pictures a few minutes after I pulled it out of the box.  I was also impressed at the picture quality--the colors are vivid and the images are sharp.  I hadn't thought much about how small a seven inch screen is, but on the bright side, it doesn't eat up a lot of space on my desk surface.  ;)  It's a great value for the money and I'd buy it again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Frame
Reviews.Author: David A. Leach "Photo Junky"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good digital frame, well worth the purchase. I bought two of these units, they are the perfect size for desk and side-table viewing. My 80 year old mother can operate it and has asked for more pictures to be added that 1000 photo's was not enough. I will buy more and I would recomend this to any one interested.

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: Karen Golemon
Reviews.Content: The frame was smaller than I expected, but the picture quality is fantastic. It was easy to load. I just took the memory card from my camera and placed it in the slot. It automatically copied every picture to the frame. When I removed the card all that was left was to delete the pictures I did not want in this frame. It was a simple 2 click process.

Reviews.Title: piece of plastic JUNK dont even bother
Reviews.Author: BLONNDI "BLONNDI"
Reviews.Content: Was very excited to recieve this because of how EASY its supposed to work. The charging unit is from another country, apparently and they have this plastic thing you slip over the charger to make it USA compatible. The charger lit up but the juice never makes it to the frame. Yes, I know theres a button for power, I am not an idiot! so pressing that for 3 seconds it never came on.  A real serious piece of Kodak CRAP. I'm returning this for sure. junk!

Reviews.Title: worst qualtiy of anything i have bought on amazon
Reviews.Author: Samuel Solomon
Reviews.Content: i just bought two of these units and both of them DO NOT TURN ON! I have never experienced such horrible quality. I am returning both units.I almost think this cannot be true but it is. DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM.

Reviews.Title: Looks great, feels great
Reviews.Author: David Kim
Reviews.Content: One of the major gripes I have with a lot of digital picture frames is that the bezel looks completely out of proportion to most (non digital) picture frames. This Kodak P725 is aesthetically pleasing, with it's frame not making it seem out of place. My one problem with its looks is the fact that the cable included is of a different color to the frame, it looks odd seeing a jet black frame, only to see a somewhat cream colored power cable sticking out of its rear.The actual image quality is fantastic. Images come to life as you turn the frame on. Colors are sharp and bright.Options are very limited. You're given a few choices on how to customize your slide show. Shuffle and sequence are the display options, along with previous, pause, and advance picture. One might say this is a strength.If you're willing to sacrifice looks for options, this is probably the best bang for buck digital picture frame on the market.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Digital Frame
Reviews.Author: Linda J. Betkie
Reviews.Content: The digital photo frame has very good picture quality.  The instruction book is a little vague and it would have been nice if it came with a USB cable to hook up directly with the computer.  The frame does accept flash drives and memory cards for display and it is very easy to copy the pictures onto the photo frame.  It does not have a battery option so it must be used near an outlet.  The power cord is white while the frame is black.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kodak EasyShare P725 Digital Frame as a gift for both my mother and mother-in-law as a Mother's Day gift.  It was a little smaller than I had thought it would be, but the picture quality was very good.  Its VERY easy to set up and use.  I would recommend this frame for people who are looking for simplicity and ease of use. I'd say you get a lot of bang for your buck with this frame.**Update**02/10/2011I just wanted to update and say that the frames still works and are so easy to add new pictures that even "Grandma" could figure it out.  My mom has dropped hers twice and there was no damage to the frame whatsoever.  So far, so good; I'd definitely recommend this digital frame.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: This frame is really easy to use. You just insert a memory card or USB flash drive with your digital pictures and your slide show automatically begins.  I like that there is no software to install.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Images - Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Timothy P. Allen "tim4roz"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this as a gift after buying the next largest size for our own use. I still think that digital frames are a bit overpriced as a whole, but this gives a good picture and is extremely easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my daughter ...
Reviews.Author: Orlando Juan Velez
Reviews.Content: My daughter absolutely loves her Kodak EasyShare P725 Digital Frame, which I purchased as a "just because" kind of gift.  Melissa loved my Sony digital frame - which costs nearly twice as much as the Easyshare.  Having seen the Easyshare after I bought and downloaded my Sony, I was greatly impressed with the color, resolution ... and the feature that allows one to pass the frame around the room from one person to the next without having to deal - as I must with the Sony! - with the digital frame's electrical cable.  The Easyshare is fitted with an electrical cable (thank goodness), but batteries act as a backup to the cable; GREAT feature!  And all for nearly HALF of what I paid for my Sony (not that I'm knocking my Sony ...).  Great job, Kodak!  My delivery, by the way, was VERY timely - and everything arrived in tip-top shape!

Reviews.Title: Kodak P725, perfect for novice
Reviews.Author: C. Daily
Reviews.Content: This frame is perfect for someone who just wants to insert a thumb drive or memory card and have pictures displayed. Little or no changes have to be made to get the pictures to display correctly.

Reviews.Title: Nice device - you need to download instructions.
Reviews.Author: Chery A. Epperson
Reviews.Content: I liked this product very much.  It was fairly simple compared to many on the market, good quality and a fair price.  I downloaded some of my own family photos onto the frame and gave it as a gift, which, the receiver loved.  I was rather annoyed to have the need to look for instructions on line.  Maybe everyone else likes this option, but I hate, hate, hate it. I had alot of FAQ since this was my first purchase of a digital frame.  I never did figure out how to move photo's from my hard drive into the frame memory and don't even know if I can. It would have been nicer if those instructions were in the box with the frame.  Overall, I think it was a very good purchase and my brother and his kids just love it.

Reviews.Title: Disapointing product
Reviews.Author: gadget buff
Reviews.Content: I received this as a holiday gift. Unfortunately, it turned out to be a disappointment. The picture quality is only so-so. The time and effort to load a few images was unacceptable. Now, after barely 3 months, it does not turn on any more. I am not sure about the quality of other similar products, but I will stick to my screen savers.

Reviews.Title: good pick
Reviews.Author: Samual Adams
Reviews.Content: the plastic frame is a little cheap looking but it works well and picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Maureen Radtke
Reviews.Content: Frame didn't even turn on and when I went to return it to Kodak for warranty work, they denied me because I didn't have a receipt from a valid retailer.

Reviews.Title: almost just what i needed
Reviews.Author: Coach Al
Reviews.Content: I probably didn't read the description well enough, but it needs to be plugged in for power.  I thought it could stand on my dresser without a cord (no outlet handy).  Other than that, great picture, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Never  worked!
Reviews.Author: Papa
Reviews.Content: Received the Kodak EasyShare P725 digital frame as a gift. It would not turn on -- nothing, nada, zip. Contacted customer care and was sent to "repair." Was told it would cost a minimum of $69.00 to return the frame for repair. Good-bye Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, very good quality
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: I am using it for last one year. No problem at all. Very good screen resolution. Simply the best. Compatible with USB, SD cards and compact flash. Good to put it on table.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Bought one in 2009 and it worked fine for a while.  Eventually it started freezing on a picture and had to be turned on and off.  Now it is DOA...will not turn on at all.  It may be cheap but I would pay more for a better made one.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after a year
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Just over a year after i bought this for my mom, it stopped working. The green light on the power brick lights up, but the frame never boots up anymore. This is very disappointing and after reading other reviews here, I'm not the only one that has this problem. What a shame as I bought ~ 7 of these for my wedding party...I wonder if the others are still working at all now...

Reviews.Title: Great digital frame
Reviews.Author: webersrus4
Reviews.Content: Bought my in laws this digital frame to display their pictures on.  The pictures look nice and clear and the frame itself is very easy to use.  I love that it can store so many pictures.

Reviews.Title: Won't Turn On
Reviews.Author: Doc Holliday
Reviews.Content: Experiencing the same problem as many others in these reviews. Out of the box it won't turn on. Hold down the power button and nothing. could be the power supply simply not reaching the unit as there's a green light on the supply itself. Kodak needs to reconsider the crappy power supplies they're sending with these units.

Reviews.Title: Good price at the time
Reviews.Author: Nicholas T. Sparagis "Nick_S"
Reviews.Content: This frame is easy to use.  I bought it for my mom, so she can see her grandkids.  She's pretty much run out of room on the walls to display photos.  Now, it's not the best digital frame, but it's a good value and it looks nice.

Reviews.Title: picture frame
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: frame turns itself off after 1 showing of all pictures.  other frames i have loops pictures so they can always be viewed.  i need to turn this machine on everyday which defeats the purpose of having an ongoing slideshow of my pictures to watch

Reviews.Title: Great quality!
Reviews.Author: Staney
Reviews.Content: Simple but beautiful, classic look and great value! great quality, the internal memory is not huge but for 800x600 pixels pictures that means a lot of space!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Cortney Waldorf
Reviews.Content: This frame is almost TOO simple to use.. basically, plug it in and you're good to go.  Picture quality is good.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Morgan Walker
Reviews.Content: Frame is very user friendly!  Took only minutes to transfer pictures from a usb drive to the internal memory.  Picture quality is perfect.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Photo frame
Reviews.Author: Tarragonfam "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kodak frame....bought the first one almost 3 years ago.  It's technology is older, making the P725 a bright addition to my work space.  Bright, square and easy to use, I have no qualms about recommending the P725 to anyone.  My first frame has a remote and sound capability, two things that are seldom used so the no frills, cost effective P725 is right up my alley. It sits on my desk and runs from the multitude of thumb drives I have pictures on.  Plug in a USB device or an SD card and it gives great color and sharpness.  Great basic frame.

Reviews.Title: great product at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Angela "Angela"
Reviews.Content: i looked at both the less and more expensive options and decided on this one based on it's rave reviews, so i feel compelled to add to that momentum.i purchased this for my father for father's day. he's older & doesn't have a computer, so i needed something that would be easy for him to use. he was able to use this one right out of the box and loves it. the picture quality is also very good. i would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Made a great gift!
Reviews.Author: C. Skipper "scooter girl"
Reviews.Content: My mom is a real shutterbug and loves to organize and display some of the thousands of pictures they take every year. She had asked me to take a good picture of myself and my dog for Mother's Day and put it in a nice frame for her desk so I decided to go one better and got her a digital frame. The other reviews from folks said that the picture quality is very good and that it was easy to use - important since my parents tend to be a little slow to learn new technology.When I got the frame I carefully removed it from the box and loaded my pictures on it, then repackaged it and gave it to her. She loved it! I showed her how to insert their SD card from the camera or a flash drive and pull the pictures onto the frame. It didn't take her any time to master it and she has been going through their pictures on the computer and creating folders of pictures just to put on the frame. She's now loading it with family pictures to take with them when they go visit my grandparents. My granddad is very frail and confined to a bed but he loves to look at the photographs my parents bring with them. He will be able to hold the frame and watch while the pictures scroll past. Much easier for him than trying to hold a heavy photo album. I might consider getting them one too!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare P725 Digital Frame is the best of its kind
Reviews.Author: Mondo Fuego
Reviews.Content: Images are sharp ... features are great ... easy to load ... and, most important, it shows your pictures in sequential and random order ... many of the competitive models do not have the random order feature.  Great job, Kodak!Mondo Fuego

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: DrBee "DrBee"
Reviews.Content: I bought this frame for my daughter's 21st birthday. I gave it to her loaded with pictures of family and friends.Loading couldn't have been easier and the pictures looked great. The frame looks pretty nice too.  She loved it!

Reviews.Title: my in-laws love it
Reviews.Author: Christabelle
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my in-laws.  My son took care of loading the pictures and had no problem doing so.  No glitches, no problem.  We loved it and my in-laws love it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Quality
Reviews.Author: MissGuidedTF
Reviews.Content: I had another brand of digital picture frame that died prematurely so this was a replacement.  I really enjoyed the one I had before but I have to say the display quality of the pictures on this one is excellent.  The colors are true and the pictures are crisp and clear.It was easy to plug the USB flashdrive into the frame.I'd recommend this frame to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great quality
Reviews.Author: Aliesha Shepherd
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for gifts for family because they were affordable.  When I got them I was delighted to find that the quality of pictures shown was very very good.  I have a 10 inch frame by Samson and this Kodak one is a better quailty.  I love how it is set up, VERY easy to use, simply plug it in and push play.  I would recomend getting a seperate memory card to use with it as it doens't have much of it's own memory.  The cord plugs into the bottom of the frame and it sits up very nicly on it's own.  I would most deffinatly get one of these again!

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my great-nephew
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Jensen
Reviews.Content: Perfect for keeping the pictures of the newest member of the family in front of me.

Reviews.Title: Easy enough for my mom to use!
Reviews.Author: E. Gobbi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mom who is 60+ and she found it very easy to use and she is not computer literate at all. The buttons are easily accessible at the top of the frame for her but it would have been nicer had they been on the front of the frame as I have seen with other Kodak models.The fact that it easily accepts a USB thumb drive was a purchase differentiator for me.The images look great.

Reviews.Title: kodak digital frame a hit
Reviews.Author: Terry L. Weidner
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my mom who lives out of town and she loves it

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Leslie Crane
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my mom and it's worked out great for her so far. It was really easy to use, she just popped in her SD card and plugged it in. The picture quality is great. No complaints on anything!

Reviews.Title: easy and basic
Reviews.Author: shelley
Reviews.Content: Truly is easy to use.  Not a lot of features - which is just what I wanted.  Getting memory card in place sort of tough, but I find that to be the case with any of this kind of stuff.  If you simply want to see your pictures, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Geraldine H. Wescott "gardener"
Reviews.Content: It worked right out of the box!  No problems.  The only thing I would change (and maybe it's something I don't understand) is that I can't leave the chip in when I turn it off and have the my pictures come up when I turn it on again.  I have to pull the chip out and re-insrt it.

Reviews.Title: Quality at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Evan L. Prater
Reviews.Content: Out of the box and viewing hi-quality pictures in minutes.Easy to useWould buy again.......

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share P725 Digital Frame
Reviews.Author: Mary L. Dixon "Mary"
Reviews.Content: I have worked with other frames and this is my favorite.  VERY easy to add pictures to.I do agree with another's review about the white cord. I would rather that it was black like the frame.  I am very pleased with the frame and use it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Alfred D. "jorius whitman"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my mom and it's great. I transferred photos from our recent vacation to another card I bought specifically for this and it looks fantastic in every sense of the word.It's about as simple to operate as it gets, and the black frame goes well with practically any decor you've got in your room. You can set it to various types of slideshows or random, and chose for it to move along the photo as well, giving it a more dynamic view. And of course, if you have a favorite picture you just want to stare at all the time, you can always freeze it in place.The most amazing thing I found was that even when you view it from far away, the pictures are still easy to distinguish and see, unlike normal picture frames.If you or your relatives complain that printing pictures is a waste of money and that you never look at them anymore, this is really for you. You can just slip your memory card in and view it all easily from a beautiful frame and setting.

Reviews.Title: A gift I didn't want to part with...
Reviews.Author: Robert Nix "bomfan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this frame for my dad as a Christmas present.  I did a lot of searching for a good frame within my price range.  When this frame arrived and I loaded it up with pics and turned it on, I was happy to discover that I had found the perfect one.  The picture was sharp, clear and well lit.  The switch at the top makes it fast and easy to switch between display speeds.  The frame itself is simple in design, but compact and you can't go wrong with the simple black border.In short, I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Mom loved it!
Reviews.Author: DeadGuy57
Reviews.Content: I was looking online for something to get my mother for Christmas and found this item.  I loaded it up with about 750 old and new family pictures and she just loves it.  It was very easy to load and all you have to do is plug it in and off it goes - very simple to use.  For someone who's been telling me for years (I'm 52) not to get her anything, she was gushing all over this revolving picture frame.  I could not have hoped for a better response and highly recommend this Kodak product.  The price at Amazon, as usual, was the best.

Reviews.Title: Nice frame for the office desk
Reviews.Author: Alex Chaney "spilot77"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this frame as a gift for my mother after having tried out a couple of others.  What I like about this frame is the solid feel of the construction and the ease of use.  For this gift I didn't want a frame with a lot of controls and confusing options.  The Kodak frame is simple to use and operate and has a good quality picture.  The actual picture size is roughly the same as a 4x6 inch print.  It fits nicely on an office desk but I would probably want something bigger it were going to be used on a shelf or table further from the viewer.

Reviews.Title: So slow it is infuriating
Reviews.Author: Ewen Wallace "CAD Bloke"
Reviews.Content: Nice pictures but this thing is so painfully slow to use that it's infuriating.It took just over 10 minutes just to boot up to display the pictures (in random order, from internal memory) after spending literally hours loading 3200 pictures onto it. Copying 320MB to the internal memory took well over an hour - more like 2 hours. All of the pictures are 800x600 so there isn't much resizing going on - just the vertical pics.[update] It boots in a minute or 2 with an older MMC. The lesson here is Do Not use the internal memory !!Pretty picture for its size & price but it sucks to use. A lot. If this is Kodaks' standard for the 21st century then I forsee they'll end up in the tar pit when the 20th century momentum of their brand name runs out.Nice pictures (for the price), if a little soft, but a terrible user experience. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but not a clear a picture as I would like
Reviews.Author: John H. Jones
Reviews.Content: This is a good product for the price. I expected it to be clearer than it was, but it is definitely satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: good but a bit of problems
Reviews.Author: Anand Gulati
Reviews.Content: bought two of these too, one of them had an faulty adapter, which wasnt replaced

Reviews.Title: Five stars to Amazon customer service.
Reviews.Author: Spin Doctor "Doc"
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: This is not a product review. It is a comment on the service I received from Amazon after the USPS failed to deliver the product, a gift that I ordered to be sent directly to my brother in O'Fallon (formerly St. Charles), Missouri.I chose "Super Saver Shipping" with an estimated delivery date of 12/18, one day before my brother's birthday. The frame shipped quickly and actually arrived at the St. Charles postal facility on 12/14. It remained there, apparently untouched, until after Christmas, before being sent back to the shipper in Phoenix, AZ, with no attempt at delivery.Why? Until several years ago, my brother's address was St. Charles. He has not moved, nor has his street address changed, but after some zoning changes his "city" address is now O'Fallon. I had mistakenly used an address on file at Amazon that still gave it as St. Charles. I would think the St. Charles post office could have easily figured out the error and made the delivery anyway, but they did not.So my brother did not receive his frame. Were I to point fingers, I'd say either I was to blame or the post office. It was Amazon, however, who came to the rescue.After I contacted them about the problem (having noticed on the tracking data that the parcel was suddenly leaving Missouri and heading for Arizona), they volunteered to ship a replacement order, no extra charge, to the correct address right away. And they used UPS one-day delivery.I've had my share of bad consumer experiences, but this was a refreshing change of pace. My thanks to Amazon for providing such wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Johnny Turner "jturner"
Reviews.Content: The frame arrived DOA. I called tech support and was told it was probably the fault of my flash drive and that it needed formatting. I tried a reformatted flash drive (Sandisk) and a newly formatted SDHC (Sandisk also) and nada, zip, nothing. The frame never would power up. POS

ProductInfo.Features:
Great value-stunning 7" display enhanced by KODAK Color Science Technology
7 in. (17.8 cm) high-resolution 4:3 display
Powered by an ENERGY STAR Qualified Adapter for a better environment
Store up to 4,000 pictures with 512 MB internal memory and automatic picture resizing
Plug-and-play operation with simple one-click controls
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare P725 Digital Frame
